item.content:encoded:
…I confess I have no idea what you're going on about. Where do AA missions (or ally drops) enter into this?

Yes, of course, these are very few items for which it makes sense to bother using Power of Greass. And yet, those items exist. Are you really suggesting that because something is useful only rarely, therefore it's not useful at all?

As befitting something that isn't needed much, you also get very few uses of it in a season. In fact, in Season 1, you can use it five times. For that matter, if you get it in Season 1, there are likely to be exactly five missions on which you will want to use it. It's almost as if it were designed that way…

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
~.~ even then. let me hand you an example.
Say an item drops 10% of the time on a mission. The best way to utilize Greass would be to push yourself to 10 stamina, jump to AA-rank missions, and then launch PoG. In R00t, this is a wise move, because while your farming bits and stuff, you've got a guaranteed drop elsewhere. ONLY drops. flavor text doesn't treat ally finds as drops. Now, for key words to get from field to field, this is one thing, however, very few fields have items that are needed for absolute progression (r00t key words, ally Chunks parts, etc). Most can be obtained through other means, however slowly, than to just sit there and PoG it. VERY few items are worth that much chaotic trouble. Not only that, but if you push the missions to the one you want, you have to let it sit there and collect dust while you spend the rest of your stamina that would otherwise be lost (usefully). It may seem like a good idea, but the item drop would have to be seriously low.

then again, i dont know about any PW missions that drop that low, so whatever

item.content:encoded:
You do not get bloodlines fomr past connection, eighth trigram or the redeye equivalent. You get the looping jutsu flying thunder god technique, advanced whiteye or advanced redeye, respectively. You can not learn bloodline-specific jutsu, and you can choose from any of the 3 starting bloodlines (although choosing the same as your new jutsu would be foolish unless you were after a bloodline specific looping permanent, such as eye of the tiger/jazz hands/whiteye version)
Therefore a) you should get bloodline specific permanents of the relavent type before getting this ability
b) you should only choose TWO of these, because you will can choose the last one each time you loop again
c) it does loop
d) if you want to get all of them, choose the bloodline relavent jutsu/traits you like most
Legacy's extra stamina/chakra
Whiteye's better specific jutsu/extra levels
Redeye's extra XP/AP and value meal (really the only good redeye only jutsu)
